html:
He is gone up to Bajith, and to Dibon, the high places, to weep. The inhabitants of Moab go to their temples (Hebrew Byth, "temple") and high places to mourn and lament because of the destruction.

Moab shall howl over Nebo, and over Medeba. The nation will also mourn for the destruction of Nebo and Medeba, two of Moab's notable cities.

on all their heads shall be baldness/every beard cut off. It was customary for males to demonstrate their sorrow by shaving their heads and beards (22:12; Micah 1:16). The once proud inhabitants of Moab are now reduced to humility and shame.
